pr_title: Add LogLevel Hooks to HttpLogOptions and HttpLoggingPolicy

timeline.message: Add functions to HttpLogOptions to determine the log level for request and response logging
Added configuration for custom HTTP request and HTTP response logging
Add HttpRequestLogger and HttpResponseLogger interfaces which allows for custom logging strategies to be passed into HttpLoggingPolicy
Removed options bags classes that were unused prototypes
Return HttpResponse when not logging it

timeline.bodyText:
Do we need this default log level here for Http logging? I think it's okay to make all HTTP request/response logging informational by default. This will minimize the number of places where log levels are configured.
If there's a need to change teh default, then customers have the options of providing customer request/response logger using setRequestLogger() and setResponseLogger().

replies.bodyText: This could be added in a non-breaking way in the future. Main purpose was convenience if someone wanted to have all logging done at the VERBOSE level so their log4j, etc, configurations included INFO and request/response logging was too verbose.

timeline.bodyText: Do we need this method? For anyone implementing this interface, they can simply use the logRequest method to log at whatever level they want. We can then make this a functional interface.

replies.bodyText: It is meant to cover scenarios where each request could have a different log level. This could be a default interface method that just returns LogLevel.INFORMATIONAL, allowing for it to effectively be a functional interface.

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need to pass the logLevel here? The HttpRequestLogger implementation should be able to determine what log level to use (from the callContext) instead of the caller passing in the level.
